column4: ehr i've destroyed the cache dir containing all information regarding the installed packeges
there's a way to reinstall all without a clean install?
i have a corrupted fs that i've recovered
failed in buffer_read(fd): files list for package `system-config-printer-common': Is a directory
i got this errors
for various packages
does this command list installed packages?    dpkg -l
does this complete ok?   sudo apt-get install -f
doesnt' work
I can't read your mind or screen -- you need to open up and explain what is happening if you want to be helped
Jack_Sparrow i don't have a second machine so i can't do it
second machine?  can't you log on the machine in question?
ok i've tryed but it doesn't do anything
nothing at all? not even spit out any information?
i've mentioned you at the end of phrase
instead of using two machines here -- use one, clone onto the same machine
it's what i've done right now o.o
no, copy and paste this in.  dpkg --get-selections > ~/my-packages &&  sudo dpkg --set-selections < ~/my-packages && sudo apt-get dselect-upgrade
sudo aptitude reinstall $(dpkg -l | cut -d" " -f 3)
try this.  sudo dpkg -i --force-all  file.deb
not sure that will do any good.  does this return anything?   find /var/lib/dpkg -iname "*system-config-printer*"
put those errors up on a pastebin
